text: Scharffen Berger Chocolate Maker is an American chocolate manufacturing company. It was a subsidiary of The Hershey Company after it had been acquired in 2005. Scharffen Berger was established in 1996 as an independent Berkeley, California-based chocolate maker in 1996 by sparkling wine maker John Scharffenberger and physician Robert Steinberg. manufactures its own chocolate—as opposed to the more common practice of acquiring chocolate from other manufacturers—the first American company founded in the past 50 years to make chocolate "from bean to bar."
